segments.speaker: DM (Brennan)
segments.content: A frenzy of activity. Wagons coming to and fro, loaded with material. You see ranks and ranks of Revolutionary Guard stationed in one of the main courtyards of the Brethren Hall.
segments.summary: Opening scene showing bustling activity at Brethren Hall with Revolutionary Guard assembled

segments.speaker: DM (Brennan)
segments.content: Azune, you are slightly behind a balcony on a second story of one of these larger keeps of the Brethren Hall. As you see Harondus Einfasen standing before the assembled guards says, "To those of you who have proudly served the Revolutionary Guard, you are dismissed of your service effective immediately. Generous compensation for the ending of your employment will be presented to you at the gate. Your exit is here. Those of your equipment which were provided by the Revolutionary Guard can be deposited in this wagon to your left. The city and its attendant Lords-Advisory thank you for your service. That is all."
segments.summary: Harondus Einfasen dismisses the Revolutionary Guard from service

segments.speaker: DM (Brennan)
segments.content: He turns, leaves the balcony, and walks down into the hall where you and Captain Ezir both are waiting. He turns to you and says, "Well, today will be a very busy one. Lieutenant Nayar?"
segments.summary: Einfasen approaches Azune and Captain Ezir in the hall

segments.speaker: Azune Nayar (Luis Carazo)
segments.content: Yes, sir.

segments.speaker: DM (Brennan)
segments.content: "I trust that you would do me the honor of showing me through some of the attendant offices of the Arcane Marshals."

segments.speaker: Azune Nayar (Luis Carazo)
segments.content: It would be my pleasure to do so, my Lord.

segments.speaker: DM (Brennan)
segments.content: "Thank you very much." He goes and speaks quickly to one of his attendants who goes out to the yard where you see a bunch of dazed Revolutionary Guardsmen staring around. You know that probably more than half of the city's guard was standing out in that courtyard.
segments.summary: Einfasen speaks to attendant while dismissed guards mill about confused

segments.speaker: Azune Nayar (Luis Carazo)
segments.content: Amongst those that were dismissed?

segments.speaker: DM (Brennan)
segments.content: Dismissed.

segments.speaker: Azune Nayar (Luis Carazo)
segments.content: I think I'm studying the sea of these people. My understanding is that the Arcane Marshal's office has been kept intact, as far as I know.

segments.speaker: DM (Brennan)
segments.content: You walk in and see that all of your companions, and see that all of your companions, your fellow Marshals are all standing there looking, for the most part, still here.
segments.summary: Azune sees fellow Arcane Marshals are still employed

segments.speaker: Azune Nayar (Luis Carazo)
segments.content: Of those that were dismissed, did any stand out to me as particularly upset or angry?

segments.content: I mean, a lot of them.

segments.speaker: Azune Nayar (Luis Carazo)
segments.content: Okay, good.

segments.speaker: DM (Brennan)
segments.content: Yeah. A lot of them.

segments.speaker: DM (Brennan) and Azune Nayar (Luis)
segments.content: (laugh)

segments.speaker: Azune Nayar (Luis Carazo)
segments.content: Walking into the Arcane Marshals, I'm ushering in Lord Einfasen. As I'm walking past, I will look into other offices to see, is that one empty? Is this one empty?

segments.speaker: DM (Brennan)
segments.content: You walk through and I think you see that Constance, who was your record keeper, is no longer here.

segments.content: Hmm. My Lord?

Matt, back to you.

segments.speaker: DM (Brennan)
segments.content: Hello, and welcome to tonight's episode of Critical Role. Every time I'm about to talk, they say a bunch of stuff. I know you know it. But, nope. Just the first syllable of the word scrotum. Folks, tonight's episode of Critical Role takes us back to the Kingdom of Timmony where our heroes have just completed one little quest that was occupying their mind, one little quest that was occupying their mind, oh so bent on blood and vengeance. Lo and behold, Thimble, boon companion of the late Thjazi Fang has avenged his death, at least in part, avenging the closest betrayal to him, although perhaps there are many whose names could be put on an ever-growing list. However, his closest friend who betrayed him, Casimir Gavendale, got to be the Baron of Sloak for a short few days before he met his end atop the ramparts of the crumbling castle that he had sold his soul to get.
segments.summary: Brennan recaps the previous events, describing how the heroes completed their quest for vengeance against Casimir Gavendale

segments.speaker: DM (Brennan)
segments.content: Casimir, his blood soaking into his cloak, yet hangs over the ramparts, his knights released from service, his Crow Keeper companions, newly knighted by this freshly anointed baron laid to waste, newly knighted by this freshly anointed baron laid to waste, one thrown over the castle walls by Kattigan Vale. Another, I believe our other Crow Keeper died down there, was, I believe, smoten by Teor Pridesire.
segments.summary: Brennan describes the aftermath of the battle at the castle, with Casimir dead and his Crow Keeper companions defeated

segments.speaker: Teor Pridesire (Travis Willingham)
segments.content: Caught a flail to the chin.

segments.speaker: DM (Brennan)
segments.content: Caught a flail to the chin, and the last drowned mere moments ago in a wide and broad puddle--
segments.summary: Brennan continues describing the fate of the last Crow Keeper

segments.speaker: Tyranny (Whitney Moore)
segments.content: By a cool-ass dog.

segments.speaker: DM (Brennan)
segments.content: By a cool ass-dog, a Rock's mastiff. Dog drowned. "(barks) Stay down." As we well know, our companions have been traveling north for vengeance against Casimir Gavendale, who at the last moment, sold out a plot to save Thjazi Fang's life, captured and set for execution back in the city where our quest began, Dol-Makjar. For the part that he played in betraying Thjazi and leaving him at the mercy of the hangman's noose, Casimir Gavendale is no more and he has paid a bitter price, his words perhaps ringing in Thimble's ear about the life that was left for him after the faltering and ruin of the Falconer's Rebellion. And perhaps the words ringing in Wick's ears of him being truly and totally alone here without any guards.
segments.summary: Brennan recaps the motivation for their quest and the consequences of Casimir's betrayal

segments.speaker: DM (Brennan)
segments.content: And perhaps ringing in all of your ears is the noise of the enormous squid that was summoned by your Chanter's Egg as Tyranny disguised as Dr. Jizzebel Finger.
segments.summary: Brennan mentions the squid summoned during the battle

segments.speaker: DM (Brennan)
segments.content: Discussing that the castle seemed to be seized by the House of Halovar, for indeed Wick prevailing upon everyone as a lord of the House of Halovar, one of the mighty and great Sundered Houses and the patron family of the Candescent Creed, the castle was handed over to Wick as it seemed that it had been taken or conquered. However, it was quickly deeded over, both with whatever legitimacy is left to your name, but also with a quick act of forgery on Tyranny's part, altering the deed of title to the newly-minted baroness, the former Dame Cosgrove, a young lady knight who grew up here in the rain-soaked village of Sloak.
segments.summary: Brennan explains how the castle was transferred to Dame Cosgrove through Wick's claim and Tyranny's forgery

segments.speaker: DM (Brennan)
segments.content: She seems to take this mantle very seriously and we find ourselves here in Brauwla's house, Brauwla Dossiber, who is keeping a public house here in Sloak. Within the home, you've just been joined by Dame Morgaine, who you'd met on the road here to Sloak, as well as Hawkins, and Dame Morgaine, a dappled, almost calico-esque border collie-looking herding dog with some patches of blue amongst the black and white and brown. And then Hawkins is this enormous, tawny gold mastiff. He has a light billow that darkens to brown around the jawline and the paws and around the ears, accented, this enormous muscular mastiff. When I say a large dog, too, I mean in that way where his head is quite a bit larger than a human head. His head is almost a chest unto itself, a guardian dog that is, you've seen some wolfhounds out around the shepherds' flocks. Those are big and imposing. These mastiffs are not made to hunt wolves. They are made to stop armed humans.
segments.summary: Brennan sets the scene in Brauwla's public house and describes the two knight dogs, Dame Morgaine and Hawkins

segments.speaker: Hawkins
segments.content: Well met, travelers. I hope that I did not give you too much pause on the road.
segments.summary: Hawkins greets the party and makes a pun about giving them pause

segments.speaker: Wicander (Sam)
segments.content: Is that a pun?

segments.speaker: Hawkins
segments.content: Pun? Why?

segments.speaker: Wicander (Sam)
segments.content: Sorry.

segments.speaker: Hawkins
segments.content: Explain the joke.

segments.speaker: Wicander (Sam)
segments.content: Well, "pause" could in that sentence have a double meaning, meaning pause to give us a bit of a fright, and also paws because you used your paws to murder a man.
segments.summary: Sam explains the pun about pause/paws to Hawkins

segments.speaker: Hawkins
segments.content: Murder? No. I challenged him to a duel. He accepted and then when he saw me emerge from the woodline, he started to run. That doesn't end the duel. He assumed I was a man and I'm not a man, I'm a dog.
segments.summary: Hawkins explains that he challenged someone to a duel, not murder

segments.speaker: Thimble (Laura Bailey)
segments.content: And a very good dog at that.

segments.speaker: Hawkins
segments.content: Thank you for the compliment.

segments.speaker: Hawkins
segments.content: No, the only man I've given paws to today in that context would be the late Gully Breeches. Why are you traveling these lands?
segments.summary: Hawkins mentions defeating Gully Breeches and asks about their travels

segments.speaker: Thimble (Laura Bailey)
segments.content: Well, now, we're off to find your brother.

segments.speaker: Teor Pridesire (Travis Willingham)
segments.content: Yeah, that is right, we are looking for my brother, Talcydimir, Cyd, to those that know him.
segments.summary: Teor explains they are looking for his brother Talcydimir

segments.speaker: DM (Brennan)
segments.content: Morgaine looks up at Brauwla and says, "My dear Madame Dossiber, if we might have a meal for our friends here. They are, for the time being, friends of the king." She nods and says, "Yeah, I'll whip that up right away," and goes off to start collecting something for you all to eat here.
segments.summary: Dame Morgaine requests a meal for the party, calling them friends of the king

segments.speaker: Wicander (Sam)
segments.content: Is there a menu or is it sort of-- omakase. Okay.

segments.speaker: DM (Brennan)
segments.content: You see the other knights here seated. There's not enough tables in this place. Some are just seated on small casks or barrels over in a corner and Morgaine looks over to you and says, "Your business brought you here to seek out Casimir Gavendale."
segments.summary: Brennan describes the crowded tavern and Dame Morgaine acknowledging their business with Casimir

segments.speaker: Thimble (Laura Bailey)
segments.content: Uh-huh.

segments.speaker: Dame Morgaine
segments.content: I sense that my presence is leaving you slightly guarded. I must speak with our dwarven friends in the corner and I would leave you to your own for the time being, but if your travels would see you head north of here, following the envoy that left town not too long ago, you are welcome to travel with myself and my companion, my brother knight.
segments.summary: Dame Morgaine offers to let them speak privately and suggests they could travel together north

segments.content: I mean, th

segments.content: at sounds really cool, if that's okay with you, Teor.

segments.content: Absolutely, it would be most agreeable. We would be fortunate for the company.

segments.speaker: DM (Brennan)
segments.content: She nods and says, "I will leave you to your own to speak as you will." And you see that she goes and walks off over to the group of dwarves over in the corner that you can see have thick, muddy boots, mud-covered jackets. They have a lot of dirty equipment with them. These look like not travelers, but workers. They see that they have a lot of gear around them, and leaves you guys to discuss the aftermath of the battle of Castle Sloak.
segments.summary: Dame Morgaine leaves the party to speak privately while she talks to a group of dwarven workers

segments.speaker: Tyranny (Whitney Moore)
segments.content: Okay.

segments.speaker: Thimble (Laura Bailey)
segments.content: So, that went well.

segments.speaker: Tyranny (Whitney Moore)
segments.content: I mean, how do you feel, Thimble? You got what you wanted, and what do we do now? I guess we're still finding your brother, but I mean, this feels like, do you feel better?

segments.speaker: Thimble (Laura Bailey)
segments.content: Yeah. Yeah, I mean, yeah, he needed to die and-- I don't feel much better, honestly. I thought maybe if he was dead that Thjazi being dead would not be as bad, but it's still just as bad. would not be as bad, but it's still just as bad.
segments.summary: Thimble reflects that killing the Baron didn't make her feel better about Thjazi's death

segments.speaker: Kattigan Vale (Robbie)
segments.content: That's a strange thing, isn't it? You would think--

segments.speaker: Tyranny (Whitney Moore)
segments.content: Well, I'm glad he is dead. That guy sucked.

segments.speaker: Thimble (Laura Bailey)
segments.content: No, me too.

segments.content: Oh yeah, we're all glad he's dead, yeah, yeah, for sure.

segments.speaker: Thimble (Laura Bailey)
segments.content: He was really, really horrible.

segments.speaker: Teor Pridesire (Travis Willingham)
segments.content: It does seem to shine a light on how large the conspiracy against Thjazi actually was, though. Casimir feels more and more like a piece.
segments.summary: Teor notes that the conspiracy against Thjazi seems larger than they thought

segments.speaker: Thimble (Laura Bailey)
segments.content: Yeah. Isn't it strange that this long after everything that they would put a target on his back again?

segments.speaker: Teor Pridesire (Travis Willingham)
segments.content: It was my understanding that he had fallen in, found a place of use in Dol-Makjar.

segments.speaker: Thimble (Laura Bailey)
segments.content: Well, I mean, yeah, I mean, for the most part. We did some... questionable things, but yeah, I mean, he was--

segments.content: No.

segments.content: He was useful to so many different people and loved.

segments.speaker: Kattigan Vale (Robbie)
segments.content: You always got to wonder when someone ducks and dodges something for so long, why they got caught. You don't get less savvy when you get older.

segments.content: But all the Houses working together, yours and the Tachonis.

segments.content: Did you know about that?

segments.content: No, not at all. It does feel like there's something, an ill will, an ill wind blowing because--

segments.speaker: Tyranny (Whitney Moore)
segments.content: That was me, I'm sorry.

segments.speaker: Wicander Halovar (Sam)
segments.content: Oh, well. Your brother and this Thjazi and the families working together and this business over at Hal's house with everyone converging there and having different strange things happening to them as well. I met someone through Hal a few months ago and she disappeared as well.

segments.content: Who?

segments.content: Oh, just a girl. She was an actor in his troupe, but I just thought she wandered off to another town, but at this point I don't know any more. Maybe there is something, some trouble brewing. This king of Timmony is now making his way south.

segments.content: Yeah, why?

segments.speaker: Wicander Halovar (Sam)
segments.content: There's stuff happening. Well, it's not our job to figure out what, but--

segments.content: No.

segments.speaker: Wicander Halovar (Sam)
segments.content: Perhaps we should just be on alert.

segments.speaker: Tyranny (Whitney Moore)
segments.content: Well, first of all, it's not just a girl in a theater troupe. He has fully a picture that he was hugging and smooching it right before we left.

segments.speaker: Teor Pridesire (Travis Willingham)
segments.content: Oh.

segments.content: I don't really know.

segments.content: Is this a former flame?

segments.content: Not a girlfriend, no, just we connected on a-- When you go to the theater, you let go of yourself a little bit and feel emotions and portray yourself in a different way and it can be very romantic, that's all. We just felt a bit of a connection.

segments.speaker: Tyranny (Whitney Moore)
segments.content: All I know is after we would go and visit Hal and go see the shows with her, he prayed all night afterwards. He wouldn't sleep a wink. He was praying and praying and praying.

segments.speaker: Wicander Halovar (Sam)
segments.content: Unrelated, unrelated.

segments.speaker: Tyranny (Whitney Moore)
segments.content: You're just really nice.

segments.content: I'm just very devout.

segments.speaker: Tyranny (Whitney Moore)
segments.content: You're just really devout.

segments.content: What's this woman's name?

segments.speaker: Thimble (Laura Bailey)
segments.content: Are you celibate?

segments.speaker: Wicander Halovar (Sam)
segments.content: I don't think that's any of your business.

segments.speaker: Sam Riegel (Wicander)
segments.content: That's amazing. Yes, we're just little sheep out here. We need a shepherd.

segments.speaker: DM (Brennan)
segments.content: Hawkins looks and says, "I smell blood on them. I don't know how little these sheep are."

segments.speaker: DM (Brennan)
segments.content: Hawkins says, "The Tachonis envoy. We have been trailing them for some time, moving through the lands here, we had no intention-- The late Baron of Sloak was not someone that had come across our priority. We knew not what mattered he to the Tachonis or not."

segments.speaker: DM (Brennan)
segments.content: Morgaine says, "No, indeed, I believe the Tachonis did not come into possession of Castle Sloak for the purpose of pawning it off on Casimir Gavendale. That may have been an added bonus for them, but not something that they necessarily aspired to do with this place. Now, I suspect that they came into possession of this little barony to hollow something out of the ground and make their way north with it."

segments.speaker: Thimble (Laura Bailey)
segments.content: Do you think they succeeded?

segments.speaker: DM (Brennan)
segments.content: "Quite likely. They came into its possession not very long ago. The Earl of Gormalay saw fit to anoint the marriage of the late lady of Sloak to the young Lord Doset Tachonis who was the baroness' husband for all of nine months."

segments.speaker: Teor Pridesire (Travis Willingham)
segments.content: Do you know what they were searching for in this area, or--?

segments.speaker: DM (Brennan)
segments.content: "Sloak has no great wealth to speak of and the Tachonis have been moving in our lands silently, quietly for some time. They made their presence known more than in the past. I would say some two years ago, a little bit less at this time. Amongst the Sundered Houses, the Tachonis have always been a silent one."

segments.speaker: DM (Brennan)
segments.content: "In the old empire of Obridimia, there were two priestly houses that served directly beneath the royal House of Obridai. The Halovar, which were the speakers of flame, always happy to make grand pronouncements and speak on behalf of the Shaper of the sun. The Tachonis were the priestly house of shadow and of night of the passage of souls through darkness to emerge in the hall of the Shaper himself. They were a house of a duty related to the passage from life to death and to the afterlife."

segments.speaker: Thimble (Laura Bailey)
segments.content: That's why Occtis is so creepy.

segments.speaker: DM (Brennan)
segments.content: "Therefore, in the absence of any halls of the gods of permanent afterlife, the House of Tachonis, their ancestral obligations led to an ever-expanding underworld. As the House of Halovar, as you are well aware, my Lord, has seen fit to establish chapels and the movement of Halovar cannot be missed. In fact, they announce their movements as gloriously as the Light which they wield. It is their power. Tachonis have been moving in shadow, and we have only sniffed them out, I'm afraid, perhaps too late. There have been cairns this opening up throughout the land. Perhaps we should return to Timmon's Rock."

segments.speaker: DM (Brennan)
segments.content: She turns to Hawkins and nods and says, "Mm, the Stag of Seven Tines will be able to give us some answers if we start to put this information together."

segments.speaker: Thimble (Laura Bailey)
segments.content: What's the Stag of Seven--?

segments.speaker: DM (Brennan)
segments.content: Morgaine looks up and says, "Those druids of Timmony are of the Circle of the Stag and the druids of the kings are well-versed in hidden law and messages these various cairns that have been opening up. We are swift on our feet and perceptive. We can sense movements of the undead, of demons, and of fairies, but to sense a pattern like this, it requires more vision than simply to burrow in the hole after your quarry. We'll need someone that can see the forest and the trees at once, which brings us north along the King's Highway if that is indeed safe."

segments.speaker: DM (Brennan)
segments.content: "Regardless, we believe that the Tachonis have been combing our land for some hidden resource. You now follow them, you had mentioned, for a brother."

segments.speaker: Teor Pridesire (Travis Willingham)
segments.content: My brother, Cyd.

segments.speaker: DM (Brennan)
segments.content: "I smelled him there in the tavern. I would've thought to mention something, but I did not know that you were across the stream in your own cart asleep when we came across--"

segments.speaker: Thimble (Laura Bailey)
segments.content: I'm so sorry, Teor.

segments.speaker: Teor Pridesire (Travis Willingham)
segments.content: It's all right. How could you have known?

segments.speaker: DM (Brennan)
segments.content: "We can make our way, and to our own ability, try to help you find him. Once we arrive in Tybry's Lea, we will have to take caution there and get a lay of the land. But following that, we can travel with you at least as far before our duty compels us to part ways."

segments.speaker: Sam Riegel (Wicander)
segments.content: That would be incredible, but I imagine that you travel quite quickly and we don't as much.

segments.speaker: DM (Brennan)
segments.content: She smiles. Here you see the Baroness Cosgrove stands and says, "You will travel as swiftly as they."

segments.speaker: Sam Riegel (Wicander)
segments.content: Thanks for the pep talk.

segments.speaker: Players
segments.content: (laughter)

segments.speaker: DM (Brennan)
segments.content: She smiles and says, "The horses of the late baron are riderless at the moment, and you should take them and travel with them."

segments.speaker: Sam Riegel (Wicander)
segments.content: The ones that Kattigan scared off into the--

segments.speaker: Teor Pridesire (Travis Willingham)

segments.speaker: DM (Brennan)
segments.content: f the Earl of Gormalay "and the city of Tybry's Lea." You look out. Coming down from the mountains, you see Tybry's Lea, you see wide open fields of grass and a landscape that is breathtaking in its majesty. All the hedges, there was a claustrophobic fae wonder All the hedges, there was a claustrophobic fae wonder to the Miller's Road, of hedges and blooms and things and suddenly, you having left that, you can tell that you are no longer under the effects of Pass Without Trace. You look out and see that, almost the foothills of mountains where there is a long, wide slope in altitude, you see wind moving across bright green, tall grass over an endless sea of grass and farm yard. tall grass over an endless sea of grass and farm yard. There are white puffy clouds and a bright blue sky and Tybry's Lea on this very slight, it's almost level, this ever so tilted landscape that begins to head down towards this broad, mighty brown river, this muddy river cutting through the landscape, churning up with different farms and things feeding it, little rivers and creeks and streams feeding it. Tybry's Lea, you see a tall castle on a hill, and this one looks like an actual castle, not something palatial or royal necessarily, but a big stone keep, a couple of parapet walls and some bridges out to towers looking out over this massive, maybe just right on that border of, whoa, this is an enormous town or a very small city. But you see that there are pennants flying in the breeze and you can see white paper garland strung up in the early morning light. As you see people gathering, Wick, you see there are paper lanterns, and out on the road, there are small white candles in preparation for Candle Feast.
segments.summary: The party arrives at Tybry's Lea, a breathtaking landscape with wide grasslands, a castle on a hill, and preparations for Candle Feast underway

There's a lot of fields out here that are making hay. You also see that there are places where there's wheat that's been coming down, but also there's many big herds of horses here, so you see there's a lot of pasture and grazing land, but also wide open land for horses to come through. You see cresting over big, white mane of stallion horses come down. Heading towards Tybry's Lea, you enter in and Morgaine looks and says, "We've made good time on the Miller's Road. "How would you like best to approach the city? segments.speaker: DM (Brennan)
segments.content: from the break in tonight's episode of Critical Role. All of you stand in, not even an alleyway, just sort of like a small-- It's basically just the space between two buildings on this outer road. You see that Tybry's Lea on this big, wide expanse, just grows naturally like a spiderweb out from-- So the roads all kind of lead to the center of town with some little branching pathways here and there. Beautiful sunshiny day. People laughing, getting ready for the festival. You can see that a lot of this is preparation for sundown. So, obviously, it's bright daylight, candles are not being lit, but people are placing candles all the way out. It smells like beeswax and fresh-baked cookies on the street. And you see that a lot of the faithful are out walking, and you see that even a lot of the peasantry are being handed these little paper garlands to wear and add a little bit of white to their clothing as they go and approach the town square in front of a hospital that you can see. The hospital appears to be built in this old, what might have been, either a granary or some other kind of building that's been repurposed for this. Looks a little bit old and worse for wear. It might be at the time where, you know, it's lived the life of this type of building where it's still safe to be in there. But you look and see people gathering. You're still in your alleyway. As the hounds depart, you feel that sort of little bit of that Pass Without a Trace still left on you. Normally, that would go with the Hound of the King, but you can see that they've given you, probably a little bit of time to move stealthily in town if you so wish.
segments.summary: The party returns from break in an alley in Tybry's Lea, a bustling town preparing for a festival. The town has a spiderweb layout with roads leading to the center. People are preparing for sundown festivities with candles and white garlands. A repurposed hospital building is visible in the town square, and the party still has some stealth benefits from the Hounds' magic.
segments.location: Tybry's Lea, in an alley between buildings

segments.speaker: Wicander Halovar (Sam Riegel)
segments.content: If I just cast it as an action, it takes one minute.
segments.summary: Wicander clarifies normal casting takes one minute

segments.speaker: DM (Brennan)
segments.content: Yes.
segments.summary: DM confirms

segments.speaker: Wicander Halovar (Sam Riegel)
segments.content: I'll do that.

segments.speaker: DM (Brennan)
segments.content: Great. So, while you guys are talking to the rat, you're taking care of to Alarm this area back here. As the door opens, I am going to-- I don't think you guys can make a stealth here there's no way for you to adjust how loud this door is.
segments.summary: The door opens loudly, preventing stealth

segments.speaker: Teor Pridesire (Travis Willingham)
segments.content: No.
segments.summary: Teor agrees about the lack of stealth

segments.speaker: DM (Brennan)
segments.content: So this is going to be an open perception check.

segments.speaker: Thimble (Laura Bailey)
segments.content: For anybody that's down there?
segments.summary: Thimble asks if the check is for enemies

segments.speaker: Teor Pridesire (Travis Willingham)
segments.content: For whatever lays within.

segments.speaker: DM (Brennan)
segments.content: For whatever lays within.

segments.speaker: Kattigan Vale (Robbie Daymond)
segments.content: Doi!

segments.speaker: Thimble (Laura Bailey)
segments.content: What are we hoping for here?

segments.speaker: Teor Pridesire (Travis Willingham)
segments.content: Something low.
segments.summary: Teor wants a low roll

segments.speaker: DM (Brennan)
segments.content: You're hoping for, I think you guys are going to need a seven or lower on the die.
segments.summary: DM sets the target as seven or lower for enemies not to notice

segments.speaker: Thimble (Laura Bailey)
segments.content: Oh jeez, Louise.

segments.speaker: Teor Pridesire (Travis Willingham)
segments.content: God, he's being super fair and I hate it.
segments.summary: Teor acknowledges the DM is being fair but it's still difficult

segments.speaker: Thimble (Laura Bailey)
segments.content: Seven or lower.

segments.speaker: Wicander Halovar (Sam Riegel)
segments.content: We want seven or lower?

segments.content: Yes, yes, yes.

segments.speaker: Teor Pridesire (Travis Willingham)
segments.content: Yeah.

segments.speaker: Kattigan Vale (Robbie Daymond)
segments.content: Yeah, yeah, this is for the perception of the cre- Or whatever is in there.

segments.speaker: Teor Pridesire (Travis Willingham)
segments.content: Oh boy. Ooh!

segments.speaker: Wicander Halovar (Sam Riegel)
segments.content: It's bad, it's real bad.
